availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky farmer. Virginia native. Married Nancy Cox Horton in 1833. Father of Travis Horton, Rees Horton, William Horton, and Phebe Horton. Held three slaves in 1860.

bibl.p:
Virginia, Compiled Marriages, 1740-1850, Ancestry, Lee County, 1833.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 257. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Mount Savage, p. 150. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 4. “Elijah Sargent Horton,” Find A Grave, May 6, 2012, memorial no. 89643502.
